source.9881aab4:
from sklearn.metrics import confusion_matrix

cm = confusion_matrix(val_y, predictions)

TN, FP, FN, TP = confusion_matrix(val_y, predictions).ravel()

print('True Positive(TP)  = ', TP)
print('False Positive(FP) = ', FP)
print('True Negative(TN)  = ', TN)
print('False Negative(FN) = ', FN)

accuracy =  (TP+TN) /(TP+FP+TN+FN)

print('Accuracy of the binary classification = {:0.4f}'.format(accuracy))
source.a50038a0: **Outcome correlates most with glucose level; also with BMI, age and pregnancies, level of inculin**
